snippet: The former New Orleans police officers were sentenced to prison terms ranging from 38 to 65 years for their roles in the deadly shootings of unarmed residents and for a cover-up afterward.
abstract: Former New Orleans police officers Kenneth Bowen, Robert Gisevius, Anthony Villavaso, Robert Faulcon and Arthur Kaufman are sentenced to prison for shooting of six unarmed civilians in days after Hurricane Katrina, and for orchestrating a wide-ranging coverup afterward; four of the five received lengthy terms ranging from 38 to 65 years.
lead_paragraph: The former New Orleans police officers were sentenced to prison terms ranging from 38 to 65 years for their roles in the deadly shootings of unarmed residents and for a cover-up afterward.

headline.seo: Ex-New Orleans Officers Sentenced in Post-Katrina Shootings
headline.print_headline: Five Ex-Officers Sentenced in Katrina Shootings
